oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:title: Chet Atkins Interview Side One
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:description: The recording is of Bob Battle interviewing Chet Atkins. The recording takes place on 9-12-78.
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:creator: Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dcterms:tableOfContents: Side One - (0:15) -- Bob asks Chet Atkins about making an album with Les Paul. Chet Atkins says that Roy Horton help jumpstart the process. (1:16) -- Chet Atkins describes working with Les Paul. (1:43) -- Bob asks Chet Atkins whether he plays symphony gigs. Chet responds that he has been playing small group gigs recently with Randy Houser, Paul Yandell, Curtis Young and Tony Migliore. (2:49) -- Bob Battle asks Chet Atkins about his future album plans. Chet Atkins responds that he is working on a guitar quartet album with John Knowles, John Pell, and Liona Boyd. (3:35) -- Chet Atkins mentions the seven Grammy's he's won. Chet mentions that he doesn't count the awards he receives. (4:05) -- "I could've been a movie star like Jerry Reed." - Chet Atkins
oai_qdc:qualifieddc.dc:subject: Atkins, Chet;
